docTitle.titlePart:
Response of Factor V Inhibitor to Rituximab
in a Patient Who Received Liver Transplantation
for Primary Biliary Cirrhosis

2 and David Andrews

front.div:
A 43-year-old patient developed factor V inhibitor 6 months after liver transplantation for
primary biliary cirrhosis in association with Sjö gren's syndrome/systemic lupus erythe-
matosus. She suffered from ecchymoses in the lower extremities. The factor V inhibitor
was eradicated after 10 weekly doses of 375–500 mg/m
2 rituximab. Am.
front.keyword:
Key words: factor V inhibitor; rituximab; primary biliary cirrhosis; Sjö gren's syndrome;
systemic lupus erythematosus
